page.title: 03Fishing on the River Test
page.content: The River Test is the{finest trout {stream}in Europe,it is also one of the three finest trout rivers in the world,so fishermen visit it from many parts of the United Kingdom.Four people are employed to look after the river and there are three students who will look after other rivers when they graduate. There are three thousand fish reared every year.They are also sold to other rivers to stock them.The average fish caught weighs approximately two pounds.They strip the females of their eggs and rear them themselves.Leckford has a stretch of three miles for fishing and is part of the Middle Test.
